section.title: Server Requirements
section.p:
Even though the requirements are not very strict, you should consider the following metrics when provisioning the server for running the :
A processor core can handle 50 to 100 active users.
Editing an average DITA file consumes about 10MB of RAM. However, the includes a configurable caching mechanism that stores the oldest files to disk when memory resources become low.

section.title: Software Requirements
section.p:
On the server side, the following applications are supported:
Servlet container:
Apache Tomcat 7 or 8
WildFly 9.0.2.Final
IBM WebSphere Liberty 8.5.5.8
Java Virtual Machine 1.7 or newer (if started in security mode, Java 1.8 is required).

ul.li: All configuration files are stored in a single folder that can be shared amongst multiple servers in a distributed deployment. It can also be reused when you update the server to a new version. The location of this folder is defined by the oxygen.data.dir system property. If not set, a folder that is private to the application is used.If the is started in security mode, you must set the oxygen.data.dir system property.WildFly and WebSphere will erase the folder with configuration files upon restart. For these servers you must set the oxygen.data.dir system property to a folder that persists across restarts.
It is recommended that you install the in its own instance of Tomcat, without sharing it with other applications.
If you need to reload the application, you need to restart the server.
